The above user-level moderation mentioned "erase the comment", which may be taken as censorship in the traditional web. Such style moderation may be against the pursuit of total freedom of speech.  However, another style of operation can be 
[Pin comments to the top ](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1597641256_1GVfTPghbWnBKbRWpYpkRCKgMi4wFecie2/New+Functions+on+ZeroNet) 
which will help people better fight against some rubbish comments, while at the same time, not go to the extremity of censorship as by Twitter, Facebook, etc.

Free information without censorship is a special emphasis on ZeroNet. However, the 50 K data limit can become **a dangerous censorship for some users who don't know how to or just don't like to create independent forums on Zeronet**, on serious topics.  Then it means that the 50 K limit will be quickly run out, and become **another variation of censorship in a new style**.  
[About User-level moderation ](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1B4vYHwkCywhjs3GMxFSvdCraYj5dh9LTV/?Topic:5_1GVfTPghbWnBKbRWpYpkRCKgMi4wFecie2/About+User+level+moderation)

Section B), which may be against the pursuit of total freedom of speech, it needn't be considered.
The ideas in **Section A)** may be adopted. 

#By using a certain mechanism of upgrading the 50K limit to higher level for some users, it will remove the obstacle of 50K Limit Censorship.

By the way, is Nofish still alive or not? Is he disappeared by Covid19?
 It's indeed a matter of concern for active users who care about ZeroNet's progress.
